item.title: John Hume: Nobel Peace Prize winner dies aged 83
item.description: The former SDLP leader helped create the climate that brought an end to the Troubles in Northern Ireland.

item.title: Russian hackers stole trade papers from Liam Fox email
item.description: Documents on UK-US trade negotiations were leaked in the run-up to the 2019 general election.

item.title: 'Eat out to help out will definitely affect the weekend'
item.description: "Eat out to help out" is too complicated and will not mean more customers, says one businessman.

item.title: Spain's embattled ex-King Juan Carlos to leave country
item.description: This comes weeks after the former monarch was linked to an investigation into alleged corruption.

item.title: Hays Travel 'devastated' as it cuts almost 900 jobs
item.description: The firm says new travel restrictions have triggered hundreds of thousands of holiday cancellations.

item.title: Coronavirus: More jobs at risk and sewage testing begins
item.description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus outbreak this Monday evening.

item.title: Government urges post-Brexit drug stockpiles
item.description: Firms should have six weeks' worth of post-Brexit drug stockpiles by the end of 2020, the government says.

item.title: Wisbech man police feared had been killed found after five years
item.description: Ricardas Puisys was found deep in woods, where it is thought he was trying to avoid exploitation.

item.title: DW Sports chain collapse threatens 1,700 jobs
item.description: The firm, founded by former Wigan Athletic owner Dave Whelan, ran 73 gyms and 75 stores across the UK

item.title: Black civil servant accused of car theft while jogging
item.description: Dr Andrea Charles Fidelis says she was accused of being a car thief while jogging in Kent.

item.title: Boy swept out to sea at Scarborough 'followed TV advice'
item.description: The boy followed the exact advice the RNLI would give to anyone in difficulty, his rescuers say.

item.title: Malta festivals cancelled due to rise in Covid-19 cases
item.description: Escape 2 The Island, Rhythm + Waves, BPM Festival: Malta and Mi Casa Festival won't go ahead.

item.title: Americans in Africa: Why we left America to live in Africa
item.description: Three African Americans have been explaining why they left the US to find a better life in Africa.

item.title: Teacher's tips for keeping kids entertained without a screen
item.description: without a screen! Primary school teacher Jade Williams has some handy advice for the summer break.

item.title: 'I've got to know the man I killed'
item.description: James Hodgkinson died after being punched by Jacob Dunne during a drunken brawl.

item.title: What do medical conditions look like on darker skin?
item.description: Many of the pictures in textbooks or on the internet tend to show what conditions look like on white skin, but symptoms don't always look the same on darker skin tones.

item.title: Five surprising facts about inequality in the UK
item.description: Although the gap in wages is narrowing, inequalities in wealth across the UK are rising, a report suggests.

item.title: Coronavirus: How henna can help your mental health
item.description: Mehndi artists share how their art helped their mental health during lockdown.

item.title: Genoa bridge 'like a white vessel crossing the valley'
item.description: Architect Renzo Piano on his new design for the replacement for the collapsed Morandi Bridge.

item.title: John Hume: Nobel Peace Prize winner who helped secure NI peace deal
item.description: As SDLP leader, John Hume played a major role in bringing about Northern Ireland's peace process.

item.title: Beyond TikTok: Who else might President Trump ban?
item.description: Other Chinese-owned software could face difficulties in the US, if TikTok ban goes ahead.

item.title: Coronavirus: Eight ways life in the UK has changed
item.description: Life appears to have gone back to normal in some ways, but is still very different in others.

item.title: The boss who bounced her way to £3m from just £200
item.description: How Kimberlee Perry grew trampoline fitness company Bounce, which is aimed at women.

item.title: Coronavirus: How the travel downturn is sending jet planes to 'boneyards'
item.description: Amid the pandemic, commercial air fleets are grounded in some of the world's most remote locations.

item.title: TikTok: What is the app and how much data does it collect?
item.description: Microsoft is in talks to buy the US side of Chinese-owned video app TikTok.

item.title: Genoa readies new bridge two years after tragic collapse
item.description: Renowned architect Renzo Piano says his replacement for the Morandi bridge "is born of tragedy".

item.title: Coronavirus: The hidden heroes of India’s Covid-19 wards
item.description: Meet the ward boys, or hospital assistants, who are the unsung heroes in India's Covid-19 fight.

item.title: Nigerians' double blow: Currency woes and Covid-19
item.description: Three business owners explain how they are weathering the economic fallout.

item.title: Hiroshima and Nagasaki: Women survivors of the atomic bombs
item.description: August marks the 75th anniversary of the atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki in 1945.

item.title: Coronavirus: What happens if I'm in an area on the watchlist?
item.description: How health bosses decide whether a town should go back into lockdown if Covid-19 cases rise.

item.title: Dortmund set 10 August deadline for Man Utd target Sancho deal
item.description: Borussia Dortmund set a 10 August deadline for any deal for Jadon Sancho - Manchester United's top transfer target - to be agreed.

item.title: O'Sullivan wins in record time to reach second round
item.description: Five-time winner Ronnie O'Sullivan completes his first-round demolition of Thailand's Thepchaiya Un-Nooh in a World Championship record 108 minutes.

item.title: Bernal takes Route d'Occitanie lead as Froome finishes over five minutes behind
item.description: Egan Bernal puts more than five minutes into Chris Froome as he wins stage three of the Route d'Occitanie to take the overall lead.

item.title: Stokes boosts England by bowling in nets before first Test against Pakistan
item.description: England all-rounder Ben Stokes bowled at training on Monday as he strives for full fitness for the first Test against Pakistan which starts on Wednesday.

item.title: Coronavirus: How can I use the 'eat out to help out scheme'?
item.description: Thousands of venues will take part in a discounting scheme to help boost the hospitality industry.

item.title: Coronavirus: Do people still have to shield?
item.description: As restrictions lift, you might feel anxious about how to stay safe. Here's what experts advise.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the new lockdown rules for Greater Manchester?
item.description: More than four million people in northern England face new restrictions, but what does a local lockdown mean?

item.title: Coronavirus in the UK: How many confirmed cases are there in your area?
item.description: Key graphics explaining how coronavirus has spread in the UK and the government's response.

item.title: Coronavirus symptoms: What are they and how do I protect myself?
item.description: Loss of taste and smell have been added to the UK's list of coronavirus symptoms.

item.title: Coronavirus: What tests are available?
item.description: What are the tests for coronavirus, who are they for and how do they work?

item.title: Coronavirus: How are pubs keeping customers safe?
item.description: Pubs and restaurants in England, Scotland and Northern Ireland can reopen inside, but do I need to book ahead?

item.title: 'Bay of Piglets': A 'bizarre' plot to capture a president
item.description: How did exiled Venezuelans and former US Special Forces end up joining what looked from the outset like a suicide mission?
